introduction: Asclepias syriaca, commonly called common milkweed, butterfly flower, silkweed, silky swallow-wort, and Virginia silkweed, is a species of flowering plant.[2][3] It is native to southern Canada and much of the United States east of the Rocky Mountains, excluding the drier parts of the prairies.[4] It is in the genus Asclepias, the milkweeds. It grows in sandy soils as well as other kinds of soils in sunny areas.
